lines.text: Wes, Beryl Thibodeaux from the rape something or other wants to see you.
I did. She said she'd wait.
Good. Tell her I'm out of town.
[Wes turns around and sees Beryl standing there, she who gives him a sarcastic grin]

Twenty-eight years ago I borrowed 40 dollars from my father, packed up an old, beat up suitcase, took a bus and came here. I was seventeen at the time. While I walked through the French Quarter, I looked out over the Mississippi and swore I'd never leave.
Only once. When I looked down and saw that the suitcase was missing.

[to her father]
You can have a hard-on anytime you want.
Do you investigate many sexual crimes?
I was wondering if they've had any... effect on you.
Well, they did make me want to treat my wife a little more tenderly.
She said she wasn't interested in tenderness.
